含义: The character '岁' primarily means 'year' or 'age'. It is often used to denote the passage of time, particularly in the context of a person's age or the duration of an event.
字形: The character '岁' is composed of two parts: the top part '山' (mountain) and the bottom part '夕' (evening). The structure symbolizes the passage of time, as mountains stand firm over time and evenings mark the end of a day.
读音: The pronunciation of '岁' is 'suì' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '岁' originally depicted a ritual involving the sacrifice of animals at the end of the year, symbolizing the passage of time. Over time, its meaning evolved to represent the concept of a year or age.
成语: 岁月如梭 (suì yuè rú suō) - Time flies like a shuttle
岁寒三友 (suì hán sān yǒu) - Three friends of winter (pine, bamboo, and plum)
例句: 岁月不饶人。 (Time waits for no one.)
他已经六十岁了。 (He is already sixty years old.)
短故事: In ancient China, there was a tradition of celebrating the '岁' (year) with a grand festival at the end of the lunar year. People would gather to honor their ancestors and pray for a prosperous new year. This tradition highlighted the importance of time and the cyclical nature of life.

Another story involves a wise old man who would always say, '岁月如梭，珍惜当下' (Time flies like a shuttle, cherish the present). His words reminded everyone to value their time and make the most of every moment.
诗词:
《静夜思》 - 李白
床前明月光，疑是地上霜。
举头望明月，低头思故乡。
(Though not directly mentioning '岁', this poem reflects on the passage of time and longing for home.)

《岁暮》 - 杜甫
岁暮阴阳催短景，天涯霜雪霁寒宵。
五更鼓角声悲壮，三峡星河影动摇。
(This poem vividly describes the end of the year and the cold, reflective atmosphere it brings.)
